Charlie Kirk's assassination shocks the US and triggers a surge of political hatred
subhead: Charlie Kirk, a MAGA icon close to Donald Trump and an influencer revered by young conservatives, was shot dead on Wednesday, September 10, in Utah. His death once again plunges the country into political violence.

title: French growth expected to reach 0.8% in 2025 as political uncertainty weighs
subhead: The French economy remains sluggish in a recovering Europe. A lack of confidence has set in since the dissolution of the Assemblée Nationale in 2024, leading businesses to invest less and households to reduce their spending.

title: Iran FM says prisoner swap deal with France nearing completion
subhead: The proposed swap involves Mahdieh Esfandiari, an Iranian woman arrested in France in February on charges of promoting terrorism through social media.

title: Paris's Notre-Dame breaks attendance records nine months after reopening
subhead: Notre-Dame is now the most visited monument in France. Projections anticipate a total of 12 million to 13 million visitors by December 8, one year after reopening.

title: From a Thai holiday to a Turkish prison: How two women were trapped by drug traffickers
subhead: The two 20-year-old women from the Paris region enjoyed an all-expenses-paid holiday in Thailand, then given suitcases packed with cannabis before their flight home. Their lawyers argued it was a case of 'great naivety.'

Hyundai and LG's giant US plant in shock after massive immigration raid
subhead: The South Korean companies' metaplant in Georgia was the target of a vast federal immigration raid on September 4, during which 475 people were detained.

title: 'Block Everything': While September 10 movement echoes the Yellow Vests, it also has key differences
subhead: While the call to 'block everything' on Wednesday, September 10, brings to mind the Yellow Vest protests of 2018, the choice of a weekday, the involvement of unions, and the support of left-wing parties give this social movement its own distinct character.

title: Behind the 'Block Everything' movement: Tight budgets and fear about the future
subhead: The surge in inflation in recent years is still being felt, fueling frustration among France's 'just-getting-by' population. Falling unemployment has not stopped the poverty rate from rising.
byline: By Béatrice Madeline and Cécile Prudhomme
